intro: Aspalathus juniperina subsp. monticola, commonly known as the mountain aspalathus, is a shrub native to the Western Cape of South Africa. It is characterized by its small, needle-like leaves and produces clusters of tiny, pale yellow flowers. The plant thrives in rocky, well-drained soils and is often found in mountainous regions. It is adapted to a Mediterranean climate with wet winters and dry summers. Due to its unique morphology and habitat, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
